bibl.title: Letter from Frances Wood to Philip Showalter Hench, November 19, 1941

div1.p: Wood thanks Hench for the copy of his yellow fever article. She also offers her opinion of Dean.

RYERSON LIBRARY BUILDING
GRAND RAPIDS, MICHIGAN
November 19, 1941
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
Thank you for the copy of your address, “Conquerors
of Yellow Fever.” If I recall correctly, we had some correspondence
recently concerning a photograph of the Dean Memorial Bridge over
the Grand River at Fulton Street in this city.

After reading the address, I have been wondering if Dean
would have been so willing to try the experiment if he had known
more about medicine. However, most acts of heroism are quite in-
voluntary and are later a surprise to the hero.
